attributes.action: Request The House of Commons to cease use of the term "Honourable Member" for a period of three years.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is established tradition that in the House of Commons Members will generally refer to each other as "The Honourable Member" or "The Honourable Lady", along with variations such as "Honourable and Learned" or, more rarely, "Honourable and Gallant".

An unacceptable number of Members would appear to have treated The House and their constituents shamefully in recent times, and I am of the opinion that the House should do penance for the behaviour of these Members, and publically recognise their shame by ceasing for three years to use the term "Honourable".

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
